New Records: The Dodgers had the longest scoreless streak to close out a playoff series in the 21st century, and third-longest in the history of the sport.
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto cruised through five scoreless frames.
Evan Phillips, Alex Vesia, Michael Kopech, and Blake Treinen retired the final 12 hitters they faced.
The final 19 Padres went down in order to end the game, failing to muster up a single extra-base hit.
Phillips earned three strikeouts and held Fernando Tatis Jr. in check.
Michael Kopech dominated the bottom of the order with his 100+ mph fastballs.
Blake Treinen wrapped up the game swiftly to secure a 2-0 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts said, 'I felt at that time he gave us everything he had and we could give it off to a very, very capable pen.'
